hints.title: N-Uniform Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality
hints.content:
2137: :label: cor-n-uniform-lsi
2138: 
2139: Under the same conditions as Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-main-kl-convergence`, the LSI constant for the N-particle Euclidean Gas is **uniform in N**. That is, there exists a constant $C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max} < \infty$ such that:
2140: 
2141: $$
2142: \sup_{N \geq 2} C_{\text{LSI}}(N) \leq C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max}
2143: $$
2144: 
2145: **Explicit bound**:
2146: 
2147: $$
2148: C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max} = O\left(\frac{1}{\min(\gamma, \kappa_{\text{conf}}) \cdot \kappa_{W,\min} \cdot \delta^2}\right)
2149: $$

2134: ### 9.6. N-Uniform LSI: Scalability to Large Swarms
2135: 
2136: :::{prf:corollary} N-Uniform Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality
2137: :label: cor-n-uniform-lsi
2138: 
2139: Under the same conditions as Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-main-kl-convergence`, the LSI constant for the N-particle Euclidean Gas is **uniform in N**. That is, there exists a constant $C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max} < \infty$ such that:

2142: \sup_{N \geq 2} C_{\text{LSI}}(N) \leq C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max}
2143: $$
2144: 
2145: **Explicit bound**:
2146: 
2147: $$
2148: C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max} = O\left(\frac{1}{\min(\gamma, \kappa_{\text{conf}}) \cdot \kappa_{W,\min} \cdot \delta^2}\right)

hints.label: proof-n-uniform-lsi
hints.content:
2154: :::{prf:proof}
2155: :label: proof-n-uniform-lsi
2156: **Proof.**
2157: 
2158: 1. From Corollary {prf:ref}`cor-quantitative-lsi-final` (Section 5.6), the LSI constant for the N-particle system is given by:
2159:    $$
2160:    C_{\text{LSI}}(N) = O\left(\frac{1}{\min(\gamma, \kappa_{\text{conf}}) \cdot \kappa_W(N) \cdot \delta^2}\right)
2161:    $$
2162: 
2163: 2. The parameters $\gamma$ (friction coefficient) and $\kappa_{\text{conf}}$ (confining potential convexity) are N-independent by definition (algorithm parameters).
2164: 
2165: 3. From **Theorem 2.3.1** of [06_convergence](06_convergence) (Inter-Swarm Error Contraction Under Kinetic Operator), the Wasserstein contraction rate $\kappa_W(N)$ is proven to be **N-uniform**. Specifically, the theorem states:
2166: 
2167:    > **Key Properties:**
2168:    > 3. **N-uniformity:** All constants are independent of swarm size N.
2169: 
2170:    Therefore, there exists $\kappa_{W,\min} > 0$ such that $\kappa_W(N) \geq \kappa_{W,\min}$ for all $N \geq 2$.
2171: 
2172: 4. The cloning noise parameter $\delta > 0$ is an algorithm parameter, independent of $N$.
2173: 
2174: 5. Therefore, the LSI constant is uniformly bounded:
2175:    $$
2176:    C_{\text{LSI}}(N) \leq O\left(\frac{1}{\min(\gamma, \kappa_{\text{conf}}) \cdot \kappa_{W,\min} \cdot \delta^2}\right) =: C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max} < \infty
2177:    $$
